adrFormatAddress: 2675 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA

originalText.text:
Good wraps made in typically 10-20 minutes if you order ahead, or 5-10 minutes if you walk in the store. The wrap combinations are interesting and pretty varied with lots of substitution options so there is pretty much something for everyone. This location has been clean when I've visited (typically for pickup through their app), and the servers trying to help quickly.

Since they've moved in their business seems to be both good and increasing. There are a chairs they put outside if you need a quick spot to eat.

Update 11/2/2022: The above was made sometime in the late fall 2021, I have since adjusted the stars steadily down from the original 4/5 to a 1/5. Their service and food quality has gone downhill. Their app no longer works, they don't take orders over the phone. Yesterday, we placed an order online, were notified by text that it was ready, walked the 3 minutes to the place, and we still had to wait 10 minutes for our order to be made. What's worse, the wraps in our order had a terrible distribution of ingredients (to be fair this has never been their strong-suit), and the chicken was hard and burnt. See photo. Changed review to 1/5 stars.

Update 12/16/22: Ventured back with trepidation, it was THE BEST wrap we have had from this place, will come back, but still wary. Changed review to 3/5 stars.

Update 1/24/23: Have ordered multiple times since the last review, each time has been great. Thank you for improving. Keep up the good work and tasty food. Changed review to 5/5 stars.

Update 1/15/24: It's back on a downward trajectory. On a recent Saturday lunch order had a) an eggshell in a wrap, and b) had two wraps with items that had been specifically UNrequested on the Wolfnights app, and c) the food wasn't ready in their stated window. Back to 3/5.

originalText.text: Delicious but overpriced. Not worth $17. a sandwich. The clever videos and photos on social media presenting a beefy, generous "wolf" version of their sandwiches..are not what you get in reality.  They are skinny and not very robust with ingredients. The "Dire Wolf" was no bigger than your average burrito (and I've seen bigger burritos).  You'll be more satisfied and full from any average Chipotle burrito.  Very disappointed.

text.text: Delicious but overpriced. Not worth $17. a sandwich. The clever videos and photos on social media presenting a beefy, generous "wolf" version of their sandwiches..are not what you get in reality.  They are skinny and not very robust with ingredients. The "Dire Wolf" was no bigger than your average burrito (and I've seen bigger burritos).  You'll be more satisfied and full from any average Chipotle burrito.  Very disappointed.

originalText.text: Waited almost 2 hours for a delivery order. Called twice for updates and was told they were waiting for their delivery person. 2nd time I called they acknowledged it was taking too long and said they would remake the food. They didn't remake it they just put it back on the grill in the tinfoil. Wraps were burnt and HARD and stuck to the foil. Grease leaked out all over the inside of the bag. Really not acceptable when you're paying $40 for 2 wraps and tater tots. Lots of other businesses here to give my money to. Not worth giving another chance.

originalText.text: I always pass this place on my way to my little ones Ped appointment. GrubHub had a free lunch deal and decided it's about time I try them out. I ordered the 1 Dire Wolf wrap in a bed of mixed green with ginger dough. I have to say it was better than I expected. I truly enjoyed it and it was filling. So many different flavors that came together to make a delicious wrap. If I had to pick one ingredient that I enjoyed the most, it would have to be the slaw. Looking forward to trying other wraps. Excuse my picture, I was 85% through when I remembered to take a picture.

originalText.text: That wrap is stretchy, chewy, delectable, and so fresh. The sweet, savory, vast flavors inside make it one of the best wraps I've ever had. Actually, the best wrap I've ever had. I got the howlin wrap, recommended by the YouTube/tik tok couple devourpowertv. One of the only places in NYC that truly lived up to my expectations. I dream of coming back and trying the other variations of wraps.
